data.text: Oandonews A Quarterly In-house Journal of Oando Group Jan - Mar, 2007. VOL. 6, NO. 1 Oando Group Announces Impressive 2006 Results: Profits Increase by 50% to N3.9BN Oando Plc, the integrated energy solutions provider, announced its 2006 full year financials showing a 50% growth in the operating profits to N3.9 billion in 2006, compared to N2.6 billion in 2005. Turnover during the year also increased to N209.3 billion, up from N182.7 billion, while profit attributable to shareholders also increased from N1.51 billion in 2005 to N2.79 billion in 2006. Based on the results presented to the Nigerian Stock Exchange and subsequently released to brokers at the floor of the Exchange, shareholders of the company should expect to receive a dividend of up to N4.00 per share when the final results are released and approved in the next few weeks, during the next Annual General Meeting. Mr Wale Tinubu, Group Chief Executive Officer, Oando Plc, comments on the performance, “We are pleased to deliver a satisfactory set of results to shareholders, with earnings per share increasing by 84% from N2.65 to N4.88. With a favourable operating environment, achievements have been made across the businesses as we gained competency and improved efficiencies. We again saw improved contribution from new and emerging businesses; Gaslink, Oando Supply & Trading and Oando Energy Services thereby creating a more diversified and sustainable profit base.” Looking ahead, Mr Tinubu added, “Oando continues to be driven by an ambition to become one of the foremost integrated industry players in Africa. The objective was to bring together CEOs of best performing companies in both the public and private sector to set the agenda that would be the basis for discussing opportunities and challenges facing Africa by providing valuable guidance and insight into some of these. The Group Chief Executive, Mr. Wale Tinubu in his opening remarks stressed the impact of the World Economic Forum on the Nigerian Economy. He also said that the Forum provides opportunities to showcase the Nigerian brand as well as its industries. Also present at the Forum were the Director of World Economic Forum for Africa, Mr. Haiko Alfeld; Mr. Leke Ogunlewe, Director, United bank for Africa (UBA) and members of the press. This year’s World Economic Forum (WEF) for Africa is scheduled for June 13 -15, 2007 in Capetown, South Africa. You would recall that the World Economic Forum (WEF) on 16 January, named 250 young leaders who have been selected Young Global Leader (YGL) 2007. Amongst them is the Group Chief Executive of Oando Plc, Mr. Wale Tinubu.
